# Running Scripts

You must have NodeJS and Typescript installed for this to work locally. If you don't want to install those, I added these to a typescript playground for you to execute. There are print statements at the bottom of the page to allow different inputs if need be.

If you do have everything installed, then run a quick `npm install` to get the dev dependencies installed. Then from there, you can run my unit tests by running `npm run test`. I have the test cases that I was given, along with some other cases I either made up or found. I also have unit tests for some of my helper functions as well.

If you want to add a console.log() to the individual files, then I'd run them using `ts-node {file}.ts`. It's easier than compiling them and running the associated Javascript.

However, to give you that option, add your console.log()s, then run `npm run build`. Then do `node built/{file}.js`
